import numpy as np
import pandas as pd 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns 
import plotly.graph_objs as go
import plotly.figure_factory as ff
from plotly import tools
from plotly.offline import download_plotlyjs, init_notebook_mode, plot, iplot
import plotly.express as px
init_notebook_mode(connected=True)
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")
data_df = pd.read_csv("/kaggle/input/covid19-variants/covid-variants.csv")

print(f"Perc sequences: {ro_df.perc_sequences.nunique()}")

source.14cd5cbb:
data = []
for variant in ro_df.variant.unique():
    var_df = ro_df.loc[ro_df.variant == variant]
    trace_variant = go.Scatter(
        x = var_df['date'],
        y = var_df['num_sequences'],
        name=variant,
        mode = "markers+lines"
    )
    data.append(trace_variant)
    
layout = dict(title = 'Num sequences for each variant  - Romania',
          xaxis = dict(title = 'Date', showticklabels=True), 
          yaxis = dict(title = 'Num sequences for each variant'),
          hovermode = 'closest',
          height=600,
         )
fig = dict(data=data, layout=layout)
iplot(fig, filename='num-sequences-variant-date')

data = []
for variant in ro_df.variant.unique():
    var_df = ro_df.loc[ro_df.variant == variant]
    trace_variant = go.Scatter(
        x = var_df['date'],
        y = var_df['num_sequences_total'],
        name=variant,
        mode = "markers+lines"
    )
    data.append(trace_variant)
    
layout = dict(title = 'Total num sequences - Romania',
          xaxis = dict(title = 'Date', showticklabels=True), 
          yaxis = dict(title = 'Total num sequences'),
          hovermode = 'closest',
          height=600,
         )
fig = dict(data=data, layout=layout)
iplot(fig, filename='num-sequences-total-variant-date')
source.98859d00:
data = []
for variant in ro_df.variant.unique():
    var_df = ro_df.loc[ro_df.variant == variant]
    trace_variant = go.Scatter(
        x = var_df['date'],
        y = var_df['perc_sequences'],
        name=variant,
        mode = "markers+lines"
    )
    data.append(trace_variant)
    
layout = dict(title = 'Percentage sequences for variant - from all sequences - Romania',
          xaxis = dict(title = 'Date', showticklabels=True), 
          yaxis = dict(title = 'Percentage sequences (from total)'),
          hovermode = 'closest',
          height=700,
         )
fig = dict(data=data, layout=layout)
iplot(fig, filename='perc-sequences-variant-date')

source.e65656d2:
# Introduction

One of the most dangerous feature of COVID-19 and any virus is the capacity to mutate frequently. The short reproduction time, the relative large R factor, the widespread presence in almost all parts of the World facilitated the aparition of multiple mutations. Those, especially the ones with increased transmission rate, put under increased presure the medical response to COVID-19 Pandemics, even after vaccination programmes started.
